net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.util

Class CSSHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.util.CSSHelper

  • public class CSSHelper
extends Object
    Provides methods to build a CSS style spec. An instance of the class holds a CSS style specification. Attributes may be added to it and the entire specification may be retrieved as a String or written to a Writer object.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

      • append

        public void append(String name,
          String value)
        Appends a CSS attribute to the buffer. If both the name and value are not null the attribute is appended as follows:
        1. name
        2. colon and space
        3. value
        4. semicolon and space
            5. So it becomes: ": ; "
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the attribute, may be null in which case nothing is appended.
        value - The value of the attribute, may be null in which case nothing is appended.

      • append

        public void append(String widthName,
          String heightName,
          net.proteusframework.core.metric.Dimension dim)
        Append the Dimension values.
        Parameters:
        widthName - The name of the width attribute.
        heightName - The name of the height attribute.
        dim - The Dimension (may be null)

      • writeAndClearStyleAttribute

        public void writeAndClearStyleAttribute(HTMLRenderContext context)
        Write the current attributes to the HTMLRenderContext and then clear the attributes. The style attributes are placed inside an HTML "style" attribute.
        Parameters:
        context - The HTMLRenderContext.

      • writeAndClearStyleAttribute

        public void writeAndClearStyleAttribute(PrintWriter wr)
        Write the current attributes to the PrintWriter and then clear the attributes. The style attributes are placed inside an HTML "style" attribute.
        Parameters:
        wr - The PrintWriter.

      • writeStyleAttribute

        public void writeStyleAttribute(HTMLRenderContext context)
        Write the current attributes to the HTMLRenderContext. The attributes are preserved. The style attributes are placed inside an HTML "style" attribute.
        Parameters:
        context - The HTMLRenderContext.

      • writeStyleAttribute

        public void writeStyleAttribute(PrintWriter wr)
        Write the current attributes to the PrintWriter. The attributes are preserved. The style attributes are placed inside an HTML "style" attribute.
        Parameters:
        wr - The PrintWriter.
